description.short: Essential mineral for food preservation and trade.
description.full: White crystalline mineral harvested from the Venetian lagoon's salt pans. A strategic resource that formed the foundation of Venice's early wealth and remains a state monopoly.
description.flavor: The humble salt crystalâ€”Venice's first treasure. Before spices and silk, before gold and glass, there was salt. The invisible empire upon which all else was built.

historicalNotes.historicalSignificance: Salt was one of Venice's earliest and most important commodities, forming the foundation of its trading empire. The Republic maintained strict control over salt production and trade.
historicalNotes.culturalContext: Salt production was so vital to Venice that special laws protected salt workers and facilities, with severe penalties for interference with the salt trade.
